title.narrative: U4 Anti-corruption tailored workshop in Albania
U4 Anti-corruption tailored workshop in Albania

description.narrative: Insatsen möjliggör en skräddarsydd workshop på temat antikorruption anordnad av U4 i Albanien. Den svenska ambassaden och den schweiziska ambassaden i Tirana kommer tillsammans att vara värdar för evenemanget. Det föreslagna huvudämnet för workshopen är utformning av insatser vid systematisk korruption med fokus på reformering av den offentliga förvaltningen.

The contribution supports the organizing of a tailored anti-corruption workshop from U4 in Albania. The Embassy of Sweden in Albania is partnering the Embassy of Switzerland in hosting the event. The main topic proposed is in designing interventions in the contexts of systemic corruption with focus on public administration reform.

Over the past decade and more, significant investments have been made in tackling corruption in Albania. The objective of the intervention was to support the organizing of a tailored anti-corruption workshop from U4 in Albania. The Embassy of Sweden in Albania partnered with the Embassy of Switzerland in hosting the event. The topic of the workshop was "Anti-corruption in Albania: what can be done in sectors".

tag.narrative: 16.5 - Substantially reduce corruption and bribery in all their forms.
16.5 - Väsentligt minska alla former av korruption och mutor.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The U4 workshop was held in Tirana on 20-21 November 2019. It brought together researchers, practitioners and civil society organisations to assess where we are and to where we should go in the context of SIDA and SDC’s on-going programming in Albania. U4 introduced an approach that aims to encourage a ‘smart’ selection of anti-corruption sectors and practices and interventions to pursue to tackle corrupt practices in Albania. A U4 Issue paper based on the background report of the workshop that is published during spring 2020. The participants created a collective picture of the nature, progress and challenges of corruption and shared ‘lessons learned’ from ten years of anti-corruption efforts in Albania. Participants then worked in groups to identify particular corrupt practices they would like to work on and focused on developing an action plan to address corrupt practices in the sectors of public utilities, customs and tax, health and public procurement. 21 participants attended the 2-day workshop. In the feedback and evaluation forms received, 50% of the participants were satisfied with the workshop and 50% highly satisfied. The Embassy joined in February 2020 the integrity week initiative of the ALbanian Government and other international and national partners. As part of that Integrity week and the presentation of the background paper on feasible actions. This U4 workshop was held in Tirana on 20-21 November 2019. It brought together researchers, practitioners and civil society organisations to assess where we are and to where we should go in the context of SIDA and SDC’s on-going programming in Albania. U4 introduced an approach that aims to encourage a ‘smart’ selection of anti-corruption sectors and practices and interventions to pursue to tackle corrupt practices in Albania. A U4 Issue paper based on the background report of the workshop will be published at a later date
